column3: Thank you, I accept (said before starting to eat or drink)

column2: いっしょうにいかがですか

column3: So long. (lit. Go and come back.)
So long. (lit. I'm going and coming back.)
How nice of you to come (lit. Welcome)

column2: おといあわせのばんごう
かいしゃをやすみます
これからおせわになります
column3: Thank you in advance for your support/help.
Excuse me, Anybody home?, May I come in? (an expression used by a visitor)
I'm sorry (to hear that)/That's a pity
Thank you, May I? (lit. I'm afraid I'll be disturbing you)

column2: そろそろしつれいします
column3: It's almost time to leave now
No it isn't, You are wrong
Please, Here you are (when offering someone something)

column2: どうぞおあがりください
どうぞよろしくおねがいします
どうもありがとうございました
column3: Thank you very much (for what you did).

column2: どうもありがとうございます
にほんのせいかつになれましたか
column3: Have you got used to the life in Japan?
It's nothing, It's a token of my gratitude

column2: また こんど おねがい します
column3: Please ask me again some other time (used when refusing an invitation indirectly, considering someone's feelings

column2: またいらっしゃってください

column3: Won't you have ~?, Would you like to have ~? (used when offering something)
Won't you have another cup of ~?
